channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: O/s 124, Metro, High Holborn, 28th December
item.description:
Street Light column appears to of been damaged by vehicle. Unknown when damaged occurred. Noticed whilst undertaking utility work. Column looks unstable.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southampton Row, Holborn, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street Cleaning Missed - Bury Street N9 7LA, 28th December
item.description:
Regular street cleaning on Bury Street , Edmonton N9 is being missed it a long road that begins from numbers 9 Bury street onwards to the junction of A10. The Road is badly littered please can we get street cleaning team out to sweep up and maintain. Thank you
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 13, Bury Street, Edmonton, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Vandalism to play park equipment, 27th December
item.description:
Vandalism to another piece of park equipment (burned slide and climbing straps) in addition to broken slide, disc swing etc. This has been broken and cordoned off for many weeks now and this park is a staple to our community. Our young children would play here almost daily. Please review progress and expedite repairs.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Riverside Road, Albany Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Narrow enclosed alleyway between emerald street and rugby st., 27th December
item.description:
Overhead ( Camden maintained) security light not working. Very dark alleyway at rugby street end. Causing potentially unsafe use by pedestrians and affecting security for residents of emerald court.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 26-34, Emerald Street, Holborn, Greater London

item.title: Keep Left Chevron Traffic Sign, 27th December
item.description:
On Bourne Road in Bexley - on the roundabout nearest to the junction for the A2 (Kent bound) and Gravel Hill: Following a road traffic collision several weeks ago, a black and white ‘keep left’ chevron traffic sign was hit by a vehicle. Please could the sign be fixed back onto its posts.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bexley, Greater London
